Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controllers.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputEventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements InputEventListener
Manages the user input and gameplay logic during the gameplay.

It connects the game logic implemented in Board and the game interface provided by GuiController. User actions are process through Board. Game interface is updated using GuiController and ViewData.

The class is responsible for:

  • Handling the brick movement.
  • Managing level progression and game speed.
  • Refreshing the GUI display.
  • Detecting game-over.

    • GameController

      public GameController(GuiController guiController)
      Initialises the gameplay, the GUI and the game board.

      Creates a new GameController and initialise the game logic from SimpleBoard and the GUI from GuiController

      Parameters:
      guiController - the GuiController that is responsible for the game's GUI interactions

  • Method Details

    • onDownEvent

      public DownData onDownEvent(MoveEvent event, boolean isHardDrop)
      Handles the downward movement of the current brick, including both hard drop and soft drop actions.

      A hard drop instantly moves the current brick to the bottom of the board, while a soft drop moves it down by one unit along the y-axis.

      If the move is triggered by a user event, the score is increased by one for each downward movement. Each time the brick moves, the method checks whether it can continue moving down. If it cannot, the brick is merged into the game matrix via the Board. After merging, the board checks for any completed rows, removes them from the matrix, return the updated matrix along with the number of rows cleared and create a new brick with their ghost piece.

      If the new brick intersects with the game matrix, it will tell the GuiController the game is over.

      The player's level is recalculated based on the number of cleared rows, and the game speed is adjusted accordingly.

      Specified by:
      onDownEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the MoveEvent verify if it is a user input
      isHardDrop - true if performing a hard drop; false for a soft drop
      Returns:
      a DownData object contains the data of the cleared rows and the updated view data

    • onLeftEvent

      public ViewData onLeftEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Moves the current brick one unit to the left on the x-axis.

      After moving the brick, the ghost piece is recalculated to show where the brick will land using Board.

      Specified by:
      onLeftEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the MoveEvent representing the user input or game thread event
      Returns:
      ViewData containing the updated positions of the current brick and ghost piece

    • onRightEvent

      public ViewData onRightEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Moves the current brick one unit to the right on the x-axis.

      After moving the brick, the ghost piece is recalculated to show where the brick will land using Board.

      Specified by:
      onRightEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the MoveEvent representing the user input or game thread event
      Returns:
      ViewData containing the updated positions of the current brick and ghost piece

    • onRotateEvent

      public ViewData onRotateEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Rotates the current brick 90 degrees clockwise.

      Boardis used to rotate the brick and recalculated the ghost piece to reflect the rotated brick's new landing position.The method ensures the both bricks stays within the bounds of the board and does not overlap existing blocks.

      Specified by:
      onRotateEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the MoveEvent representing the user input or game thread event
      Returns:
      ViewData containing the updated positions of the current brick and ghost piece

    • onHoldEvent

      public ViewData onHoldEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Attempts to hold the current brick.

      This method uses Board to get the hold brick. If a brick is already held, the current and held bricks are swapped. If there is no brick that is currently in the hold slot, the current brick is placed there and a new brick is spawned. The ViewData is updated to reflect the held piece.

      Specified by:
      onHoldEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the MoveEvent triggering the hold action
      Returns:
      the updated ViewData if a brick is held successfully; null if hold is not allowed

    • createNewGame

      public void createNewGame()
      Resets the game board and initializes a new game.

      This method clears the board, spawns a new brick using Board and refreshes the GUI display via GuiController. All scores, levels, and timers are reset.

      Specified by:
      createNewGame in interface InputEventListener

    • getBoard

      public Board getBoard()
      Returns the current Board instance used by this GameController.

      This method is primarily used for testing or debugging purposes.

      Returns:
      the Board instance currently used by the game controller
